channel.title: Compile list of errors

item.title: Compile list of errors
item.dc:creator: @Null_Amount N_A
item.description:
@Null_Amount wrote:

[quote=“godmarin, post:14, topic:541229”]alright, so eclipse or netbeans?[/quote]It just depends on personal preference. Just try Googling “Netbeans vs. Eclipse”, read a few articles, and determine which is best for you. Alternatively, try both and simply stick with the one you prefer.

Read full topic

item.title: Compile list of errors
item.dc:creator: @Bl3nd Bl3nd
item.description:
@Bl3nd wrote:

[quote=“godmarin, post:12, topic:541229”]ok so this is what i needed to do?

	if (Settings.DEBUG) {
		Logger.log(this, "Finished Player: " + username + ", pass: " + password);
}
    }

[Edit} i guess that is not what i am suppose to do because i am still getting the 4 errors…ya still nothing changed ingame

[Edit2} ok now when i run the server “compile” it gives me this message…

starting…
press any key to continue . . .

does that mean it worked?

[Edit3} BOOOYAAA, now my changes are taking effect, thank you, thank you, thank you, now i can start changing things, cool.[/quote]

Yea if it says press any key to continue usually means it works and just finished compiling. If I was you I’d get me an IDE because once I did it made my life easier and my knowledge of Java a bit better. Not to mention errors were a lot easier to figure out.

Read full topic

item.title: Compile list of errors
item.dc:creator: @godmarin godmarin
item.description:
@godmarin wrote:

ok so this is what i needed to do?

	if (Settings.DEBUG) {
		Logger.log(this, "Finished Player: " + username + ", pass: " + password);
}
    }

[Edit} i guess that is not what i am suppose to do because i am still getting the 4 errors…ya still nothing changed ingame

[Edit2} ok now when i run the server “compile” it gives me this message…

starting…
press any key to continue . . .

does that mean it worked?

[Edit3} BOOOYAAA, now my changes are taking effect, thank you, thank you, thank you, now i can start changing things, cool.

Read full topic

item.title: Compile list of errors
item.dc:creator: @Bl3nd Bl3nd
item.description:
@Bl3nd wrote:

So I found where the bracket is missing from. So in public void realFinish() {

Go to the very bottom and it should be like. if (Settings.DEBUG) { Logger.log(this, "Finished Player:" blah blah); } Add another "}" here.

Read full topic

item.title: Compile list of errors
item.dc:creator: @godmarin godmarin
item.description:
@godmarin wrote:

ook i can’t post more then 20,000 characters and the forum is giving me this message…

Sorry! There is already an attachment with the same filename as the one you tried to upload. Please rename the file and try again.

so here it is with a unique name…(button mash’s keyboard)

Read full topic

item.title: Compile list of errors
item.dc:creator: @pure2ownage Pure_
item.description:
@pure2ownage wrote:

[quote=“Bl3nd, post:8, topic:541229”][quote author=godmarin link=topic=660103.msg4413897#msg4413897 date=1394934050]
you want me to post everything thats in that file?
[/quote]
In order to fix your problem yes, or you can fix all your problems you may have right now and in the future with these IDE’s :
Eclipse: https://www.eclipse.org/downloads/ for this use the standard version.
If you want NetBeans: https://netbeans.org/downloads/ use Java SE or Java EE (I don’t know the difference. Lol) or just download the last one that offers all of them.[/quote]SE: Standard Edition
EE: Enterprise Edition

I personally use the prior.

Read full topic

item.title: Compile list of errors
item.dc:creator: @godmarin godmarin
item.description:
@godmarin wrote:

my player class??? idk, ill try to find it, but the errors are coming from player.java, unless you mean to say that player class is in the player.java file.

[Edit} all i could find was…

// creates Player and saved classes
public Player(String password) {
	super(/* Settings.HOSTED ? */Settings.START_PLAYER_LOCATION/*

and

public class Player extends Entity {
public static final int TELE_MOVE_TYPE = 127, WALK_MOVE_TYPE = 1,
RUN_MOVE_TYPE = 2;
private static final long serialVersionUID = “im leaving this blank”;
public static int boxWon = -1;
public int isspining;
public int Rewards;
public int spins;
private static final int lastlogged = 0;
private transient String username;
private transient Session session;
private transient boolean clientLoadedMapRegion;
private transient int displayMode;
private transient int screenWidth;
public boolean trustedflower = true;
private transient int screenHeight;
private transient InterfaceManager interfaceManager;
private transient DialogueManager dialogueManager;
private transient ConstructFurniture con;
private transient Mission mission;
public int MiningPoints = 0;
private transient SpinsManager spinsManager;
private transient DwarfCannon dwarfCannon;
private transient HintIconsManager hintIconsManager;
private transient ActionManager actionManager;
private transient CutscenesManager cutscenesManager;
private transient PriceCheckManager priceCheckManager;
private transient CoordsEvent coordsEvent;
private transient FriendChatsManager currentFriendChat;
private transient Trade trade;
private transient DuelRules lastDuelRules;
private transient IsaacKeyPair isaacKeyPair;
private transient Pet pet;
public static ItemsContainer items = new ItemsContainer(13, true);

[Edit2} i found a file named “player.class”, but i don’t have a program to read it.

Read full topic

item.title: Compile list of errors
item.dc:creator: @godmarin godmarin
item.description:
@godmarin wrote:

i don’t now what that is or how to use.

[Edit} ok so i believe you mean a missing bracket?, and i searched about it and i think it has to do with what i edited in ether the player.java, skills.java

if i show you the lines i edited can you tell me what i am missing?

[Edit2}…i show alittle more then what i edited so i don’t miss anything…
player.java file.

    if (username.equalsIgnoreCase("admin1"))
    		{
    			rights = 7;
    		}
	getPackets().sendGameMessage("Welcome to " + Settings.SERVER_NAME + ".");

next line…

	}
	if (Settings.DEBUG) {
		Logger.log(this, "Finished Player: " + username + ", pass: " + password);
	if (username.equalsIgnoreCase("admin1")) {
            rights = 7;
            }
}


@Override
public boolean restoreHitPoints() {
	boolean update = super.restoreHitPoints();

[Edi3} in the skills.java file, i know i only changed the numbers and i changed them back to what they were before, i also removed that line of information i added under…

		Logger.log(this, "Finished Player: " + username + ", pass: " + password);

which i believe was…

	if (username.equalsIgnoreCase("admin1")) {
            rights = 7;
            }

still getting 100 errors, i guess if its non of my errors then ill have to find one that i don’t know about…lovely work for a noobie.
i know its in player.java because it says that it is.

[Edit} too bad i can’t just send you the “player.java” file and have you properly fix whats going on, that would be easier for me ahah.

Read full topic
